Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2012 04:04PM - edited Apr 15, 2012 04:09PM by kcmom1 Hi there,  The ladies here are wonderful and have an amazing amount of knowledge and compassion to share.  I am still in the "waiting stage" at the moment.  I had hoped to receive a call on Friday regarding a diagnostic mammogram, but my doctor didn't call yet.  The fear of the unknown is the worst part.  I know that I am in "limbo" with you.  One minute I try to convince myself that it will be nothing and the next minute I am trying to plan for all the "what-ifs".  It helped me just to vent on here and know that there were others willing to listen and help.
Posts.Title: Still in shock Shachar grace56

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2012 01:00PM kcmom1 wrote: I'm in the middle of waiting as well, as you can see from my post below.  I've looked at a calendar to sort of get a feel for when things might happen, but it seems that there is a lot of variability as far as time to get biopsy results, surgery, etc.  I'm a teacher, and the one good thing in this is that we are getting close to the end of the school year.  So, at least I will have the summer to hopefully see where things stand.  I go on Wednesday for an ultrasound and then a biopsy.  Maybe I will go see the "Hunger Games" again..........
Posts.Title: May I join you in waiting? Biopsy done today. hopesma nandksmom

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2012 02:19PM kcmom1 wrote: Hopesma -Teaching is crazy these days!  I am in a state with the new evaluation system and it has driven me nuts.  I WILL say that I have a great principal.  I know that when I tell him, he will be totally supportive.  That helps a bunch.  Also, I have great teachers that I work with as well.  I think all we can do is be up front and informed.  I will tell administration as much as I know as soon as I know it.
Posts.Title: May I join you in waiting? Biopsy done today. hopesma nandksmom
